alert.note: Alert for Amite; Pearl River; Pike; Walthall (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 1:18PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern St. Helena, northwestern St. Tammany, Tangipahoa and Washington Parishes, southwestern Walthall, southern Pike, southeastern Amite and northwestern Pearl River Counties through 145 PM CDT... At 117 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Osyka to near Sun. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hammond, Bogalusa, Covington, Franklinton, Greensburg, Amite, Amite City, Magnolia, Abita Springs, Kentwood, Independence, Tylertown, Varnado, Roseland, Madisonville, Folsom, Sun, Osyka, Enon and Darlington. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 12 between mile markers 48 and 62. Interstate 55 in Louisiana between mile markers 40 and 66. Interstate 55 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 9. Interstate 59 in Mississippi between mile markers 19 and 25. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
